communications

Class VisionProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • communications.VisionProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class VisionProcessor
extends java.lang.Thread
    This is the class that does the processing of the image, and can be called as many times as necessary. PROCESSOR COMMANDS: -1: process image and send it over the socket -2: set the threshold values from the socket -3: reserved just in case for the main socket for requesting new sockets -4: sets the operations and their parameters (such as Dilation and Erosion) -5: requests the thread to continuously process images -6: requests to save the raw image to the destination provided -7: requests to save the processed image to the destination provided
    Author:
    Ryan McGee

    • Field Detail

      • blobs

        public java.util.ArrayList<int[]> blobs
        ArrayList of integer arrays, containing blob information. (They are all rectangles) blobs[0] = x coordinate blobs[1] = y coordinate blobs[2] = width blobs[3] = height

      • requestSingleProcessedImage

        public void requestSingleProcessedImage()
        Sends a request to process a SINGLE image ONLY if it is not continuously processing images

      • requestContinuousBlobs

        public void requestContinuousBlobs()
        Deprecated. 
        Requests a blob from the Raspberry Pi only if it is running continuously. EDIT: just use the requestSingleImage command. It does not take that much time.

      • runContinuously

        public void runContinuously()
        Deprecated. 
        Requests that the Raspberry Pi constantly takes and processes images, discarding the results until an image request is sent. EDIT: just use the requestSingleImage command. It does not take that much time.

      • getWidestBlob

        public int[] getWidestBlob(java.util.ArrayList<int[]> blobs)
        Gets the widest blob from the ArrayList of blobs
        Parameters:
        blobs -
        Returns:
        int array: The widest blob with [0] = top left x coordinate, [1] = y, [2] = width, [3] = height

      • threshold

        public void threshold(int blue,
                      int green,
                      int red,
                      int brightness,
                      double percentError)
        Sets the threshold values in BGR format, ranging from 0-255 and brightness from -255 to 255. This will automatically set the lower and upper boundaries based on the range and input values.
        Parameters:
        blue - Average blue value
        green - Average green value
        red - Average red value
        brightness - brightness value, added to BGR matrix as a scalar
        percentError - percentage value expressed as a number between 0 and 1

      • sendOperations

        public void sendOperations()
        Tells the Raspberry pi what must be done in what order, and with which parameters. This runs after operations have been set (dilation, erosion, threshold), and should NOT be run continuously.

      • dilate

        public void dilate(int size,
                   int iterations)
        Dilate blobs on the image (make all blobs larger from their middle). Useful for resizing the blobs back to normal after erosion, or closing a blob.
        Parameters:
        size - How large the dilation should make the blobs
        iterations - How many times the dilation should run

      • erode

        public void erode(int size,
                  int iterations)
        Erode the image (make all blobs smaller from their middle). Useful for removing small objects.
        Parameters:
        size - How small the erosion should make the blobs
        iterations - How many times it should be eroded

      • saveRawImage

        public void saveRawImage(java.lang.String destination)
        Requests that the Raspberry Pi saves the camera picture(WITH brightness change) before processing it. This is useful for finding threshold values.
        Parameters:
        destination - The path you want the file to save to. DO NOT add the file name or extension.

      • saveProcessedImage

        public void saveProcessedImage(java.lang.String destination)
        Requests that the Raspberry Pi saves the camera picture after processing it. This is useful for finding the correct values for aiming.
        Parameters:
        destination - The path you want the file to save to. DO NOT add the file name or extension.

      • stopThread

        public void stopThread()
        Halts requests for images, closes listeners, sockets and I/O streams, and ends the thread. Any requests made for single images will be discarded unless creating a new object. NOTE: to stop the Vision Processor threads (in the case of enabling / disabling) the RaspberryPi object MUST call the stopAllThreads function before the VisionProcessor object does. (It is a case of timing between sockets). If you are still getting a Connection abort: socket write error on EITHER the rio or the pi, increase the time delay in VisionProcessor.stopThread().
